intro: Hymenodictyon excelsum var. velutinum, commonly known as the velvetleaf hibiscus, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. The plant has velvety, hairy leaves that give it its common name, and it is native to tropical regions of South America. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forest edges. Its structure includes a woody stem with opposite, ovate leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds.
